newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen adding reserves via customer or term RPs.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen adding reserves via customer or term RPs.

text.p: The Federal Reserve is expected to add temporary reserves to the banking system Tuesday via either customer or term repurchase agreements, analysts said.
"Our call today is for a customer RP to supplement yesterday's three-day system (repos)," said Dana Saporta, economist at Stone and McCarthy Research Associates Inc.
Economists at consulting firm MMS International Inc are expecting the Fed to add reserves to the system through term system repurchase agreements. Analysts estimated the Fed's
add need for Tuesday between $1.5 and $2.0 billion.
At 1035 EST/1535 GMT, federal funds were traded at 5-3/16 percent, below the Fed's 5-1/4 percent target.
Analysts said the market is still expecting the Fed to add permanent reserves to the banking system through a coupon pass operation soon.
